trans-unit.source: Define a custom API that supports pull notifications | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Define a custom API that supports pull notifications | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to Define a custom API that supports periodic notifications in Windows Store apps that use Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to Define a custom API that supports periodic notifications in Windows Store apps that use Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use a custom API to support periodic notifications in a Windows Store app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use a custom API to support periodic notifications in a Windows Store app.

trans-unit.source: With period notifications enabled, Windows will periodically access your custom API endpoint and use the returned XML, in a tile-specific format, to update the app tile on start menu.
trans-unit.target: With period notifications enabled, Windows will periodically access your custom API endpoint and use the returned XML, in a tile-specific format, to update the app tile on start menu.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Periodic notifications].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Periodic notifications].

trans-unit.source: You will add this functionality to the app that you created when you completed either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] tutorials.
trans-unit.target: You will add this functionality to the app that you created when you completed either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] tutorials.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you will complete the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To do this, you will complete the following steps:

trans-unit.source: [Define the custom API]
trans-unit.target: [Define the custom API]

trans-unit.source: [Update the app to turn on period notifications]
trans-unit.target: [Update the app to turn on period notifications]

trans-unit.source: [Test the app]
trans-unit.target: [Test the app]

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] tutorials.
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete either [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app] tutorials.

trans-unit.source: Log into the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.
trans-unit.target: Log into the [Azure Management Portal], click Mobile Services, and then click your app.

trans-unit.source: Click the API tab, and then click Create a custom API.
trans-unit.target: Click the API tab, and then click Create a custom API.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Create a new custom API dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Create a new custom API dialog.

trans-unit.source: Change Get permission to Everyone, type tiles in API name, and then click the check button.
trans-unit.target: Change Get permission to Everyone, type tiles in API name, and then click the check button.

trans-unit.source: This creates the new API with public GET access.
trans-unit.target: This creates the new API with public GET access.

trans-unit.source: Click the new tiles entry in the API table.
trans-unit.target: Click the new tiles entry in the API table.

trans-unit.source: Click the Script tab and replace the existing code with the following:
trans-unit.target: Click the Script tab and replace the existing code with the following:

trans-unit.source: This code returns the top 3 uncompleted items from the TodoItem table, then loads them into a JSON object passed to the wns.createTileSquareText01 function.
trans-unit.target: This code returns the top 3 uncompleted items from the TodoItem table, then loads them into a JSON object passed to the wns.createTileSquareText01 function.

trans-unit.source: This function returns the following tile template XML:
trans-unit.target: This function returns the following tile template XML:

trans-unit.source: The exports.get function is used because the client will send a GET request to access the tile template.
trans-unit.target: The exports.get function is used because the client will send a GET request to access the tile template.

trans-unit.source: This custom API script uses the Node.js wns module, which is referenced by using the require function.
trans-unit.target: This custom API script uses the Node.js wns module, which is referenced by using the require function.

trans-unit.source: This module is different from the <linkText>wns object</linkText><title></title> returned by the <linkText>push object</linkText><title></title>, which is used to send push notifications from server scripts.
trans-unit.target: This module is different from the <linkText>wns object</linkText><title></title> returned by the <linkText>push object</linkText><title></title>, which is used to send push notifications from server scripts.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will modify the quickstart app to start periodic notifications that update the live tile by requesting the new custom API.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will modify the quickstart app to start periodic notifications that update the live tile by requesting the new custom API.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the quickstart app from the previous tutorial.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the quickstart app from the previous tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Make sure at least one item is displayed.
trans-unit.target: Make sure at least one item is displayed.

trans-unit.source: If there are no items, type text in Insert a TodoItem, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: If there are no items, type text in Insert a TodoItem, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, open the App.xaml.cs project file and add the following using statement:
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, open the App.xaml.cs project file and add the following using statement:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code into the OnLaunched event handler:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code into the OnLaunched event handler:

trans-unit.source: This code turns on period notifications to request tile template data from the new tiles custom API.
trans-unit.target: This code turns on period notifications to request tile template data from the new tiles custom API.

trans-unit.source: Select a [PeriodicUpdateRecurrance] value that best matches the update frequency of your data.
trans-unit.target: Select a [PeriodicUpdateRecurrance] value that best matches the update frequency of your data.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the app again.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio, press the F5 key to run the app again.

trans-unit.source: This will turn on periodic notifications.
trans-unit.target: This will turn on periodic notifications.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Start screen, locate the live tile for the app, and notice that item data is now displayed in the tile.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Start screen, locate the live tile for the app, and notice that item data is now displayed in the tile.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have created a periodic notification, consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services topics:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have created a periodic notification, consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services topics:

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with push notifications]
Periodic notifications are managed by Windows and occur only on a predefined schedule.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with push notifications]
Periodic notifications are managed by Windows and occur only on a predefined schedule.

trans-unit.source: Push notifications can be sent by the mobile service on demand and can be toast, tile, and raw notifications.
trans-unit.target: Push notifications can be sent by the mobile service on demand and can be toast, tile, and raw notifications.

trans-unit.source:
[Mobile Services server script reference]
Learn more about creating custom APIs.
trans-unit.target:
[Mobile Services server script reference]
Learn more about creating custom APIs.

trans-unit.source:
[Mobile Services .NET How-to Conceptual Reference]
Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with .NET.
trans-unit.target:
[Mobile Services .NET How-to Conceptual Reference]
Learn more about how to use Mobile Services with .NET.
